questions.question: What does it mean by 'Intersections of Oppression'?

choices.answer: When a person who is oppressed meets another
when someone is defined by multiple oppressed elements of ID
When faced with oppression.
When verbally attacked by someone while driving 'Road Rage'

questions.question: What does it mean to have 'Privilege'?

choices.answer: Having an unearned advantage
To have an advantage simply based on factors of identity.
To be able to over-empower certain groups in society
All of the above
It is the relative social standing/prestige of an individual
A belief that each individual/group has right to=opportunity
Policies, practices, procedures with an exclusionary impact.
Not 1 and 2 but only 3
